conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true cutaway 3D model: walls are extruded with thickness, multiple faces are visible, rooms read as volumetric spaces, and the camera is an elevated angled/isometric view with the ceiling removed.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall height/thickness, readable floor-vs-wall separation, clean corners and consistent 3D geometry. Cutaway is clean with interior exposed; minor small geometry simplifications at openings/trim.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room count and adjacency match: kitchen/dining at left, living central/top, bedrooms to the right, bathroom centered lower, laundry/closet left-lower. Some proportional deviations (room depths/partition lengths) and a few doorway positions/swing details appear simplified versus the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture and fixtures are present and placed in correct rooms (kitchen run, dining table, living seating, beds, bathroom tub/sink/toilet). Minor scale/orientation simplifications (e.g., some casework/wardrobe placement not exactly as implied by plan).

visual_clarity.notes: Walls/openings are easy to parse; lighting supports visibility. Minor soft rendering/occlusion makes a couple of door/window edges less crisp; otherwise coherent materials and clean presentation.

detected_errors.description: Minor layout/proportion drift: some internal partition lengths and room aspect ratios appear slightly altered compared to the 2D plan.
Some door placement/swing and opening proportions look simplified relative to the 2D plan (not all arcs/positions match exactly).
Slight softness in rendering around openings reduces edge clarity in a few locations, but geometry remains readable.

summary: A clear, true 3D cutaway conversion with strong layout fidelity and complete interior elements, with only minor proportional and opening-detail mismatches versus the 2D plan.
